name: King Edward VII and Queen Alexandra: Visit to the Guildhall
obverse: Busts of King Edward VII and Queen Alexandra: facing left.
obverse_inscriptions: IN HONOUR OF THE VISIT OF THEIR MAJESTIES KIND EDWARD VII & QUEEN ALEXANDRA TO THE CORPORATION OF THE CITY OF LONDON
reverse: A woman reprsenting Londinia addressing the seated King and Queen. A trumpeter is on the right. Behind them is the Guildhall. A wreath, sword, and mace are below.
description: This medal was made to commemorate the visit of King Edward VII and Queen Alexandra to the Guildhall in London.
